page.title: 02OLD & YOUNG: WHAT WE DO
page.content: We went to Somerset Court in Cheveley where old people live, and talked to Mrs Allard about what she does on a normal day. She firstly has breakfast, then does her housework and then spends her day visitingfriends to help them out. At 4.30pm she often goes shopping, then goes back to her house to have dinner. On some nights she goes to the community room for bingo and a cup of tea. On Tuesday night, it is bingo in the village hall, on Wednesday she attends 'Evergreens', an old peoples club, and on Thursday it's bingo again. I (Mark Paxton), have breakfast and go to school. At 3.30pm I go home, get changed and go out to play, or do any homework I have. At 6pm I have my dinner. Afterwards I spend until 8pm playing with my friends. I then have my tea, and go to bed.
